The positive staining for acid-fast bacilli suggest tuberculosis meningitis, which requires long-term use of isoniazid and rifampin. Liver function abnormalities can occur with anti-TB medications, so the patient needs to have regular liver enzyme monitoring. Acyclovir is not necessary since the CSF analysis did not suggest viral meningitis, and treatment should not be delayed until culture results are available since tuberculosis meningitis is a medical emergency.
